actor_awards.notes: Chevalier received an Honorary Academy Award in 1959 for his contributions to the world of entertainment. He was also nominated for Best Actor in 1930 for 'The Big Pond' and 'The Love Parade'.

filmography.title: Gigi
filmography.role_description: An aging, charming boulevardier and playboy who observes the romance between his nephew and the title character, famously singing 'Thank Heaven for Little Girls'.
filmography.plot: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship, but it may not stay platonic for long.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical; Film won 9 Oscars including Best Picture

filmography.title: Love in the Afternoon
filmography.role_description: A private detective in Paris specializing in unfaithful spouses, whose daughter becomes entangled with one of his targets.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged playboy becomes fascinated by the daughter of a private detective who has been hired to entrap him with the wife of a client.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: The Love Parade
filmography.role_description: A womanizing military attaché who marries the Queen of Sylvania but finds his role as a Prince Consort with no power to be humiliating.
filmography.plot: Count Alfred Renard is ordered back to Sylvania to marry Queen Louise, but he soon finds his new role as a figurehead husband unbearable.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture

filmography.title: Love Me Tonight
filmography.role_description: A Parisian tailor who poses as a baron to collect a debt from a nobleman, only to fall in love with a princess.
filmography.plot: A tailor posing as a nobleman moves into a family castle to collect a debt and falls in love with a princess, famously singing 'Mimi'.

filmography.title: The Smiling Lieutenant
filmography.role_description: A lieutenant in the Viennese guard who is forced into a marriage with a princess after a misunderstood wink.
filmography.plot: A lieutenant winks at his girlfriend in a crowd, but the smile is intercepted by a visiting princess who insists on marrying him.

filmography.title: One Hour with You
filmography.role_description: A happily married doctor who finds his fidelity tested by his wife's flirtatious best friend.
filmography.plot: A married doctor is faithful to his wife until her best friend sets her sights on him, leading to a comedic series of misunderstandings.

filmography.title: The Merry Widow
filmography.role_description: A dashing prince who is ordered by his king to woo a wealthy widow to keep her fortune within their small kingdom.
filmography.plot: Count Danilo is ordered to seduce and marry a rich widow to save his country's economy, not realizing she is the woman he fell in love with the night before.

filmography.title: Fanny
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, kind-hearted older merchant who marries a young pregnant woman to save her from shame, knowing she loves another.
filmography.plot: In 1920s Marseilles, a young girl pregnant by a sailor who has abandoned her marries an older man to give her child a name.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Drama; Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture

filmography.title: In Search of the Castaways
filmography.role_description: An absent-minded but enthusiastic French geography professor who aids two children in the search for their missing father.
filmography.plot: A teenage girl and her young brother, accompanied by a French professor, set out on a worldwide search to find their shipwrecked father.

filmography.title: The Big Pond
filmography.role_description: A French guide who falls for an American chewing-gum heiress and tries to succeed in business in the U.S. to win her father's approval.
filmography.plot: To prove himself worthy of an American heiress, a Frenchman travels to the United States to work in her father's chewing gum factory.

filmography.title: A Bedtime Story
filmography.role_description: A carefree Parisian playboy whose life is turned upside down when he discovers an abandoned baby in his car.
filmography.plot: A French playboy finds an abandoned baby in his car and decides to raise the child, complicating his relationship with his fiancée.

filmography.title: Folies Bergère de Paris
filmography.role_description: Chevalier plays a dual role as a music hall entertainer and a wealthy baron who look exactly alike, leading to a comedy of errors.
filmography.plot: A Folies Bergère entertainer impersonates a lookalike baron to help him out of a financial jam, confusing both the baron's wife and his own girlfriend.

filmography.title: Le silence est d'or (Man About Town)
filmography.role_description: An aging film director in 1906 Paris who mentors a young woman and falls in love with her, only to lose her to a younger man.
filmography.plot: An aging silent film director in Paris takes a young girl under his wing and falls for her, but she falls for his young protégé.
filmography.awards: Locarno International Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Pièges (Personal Column)
filmography.role_description: A charming nightclub owner who becomes a suspect in a serial killer investigation involving lonely hearts ads.
filmography.plot: A dance hostess goes undercover for the police to catch a serial killer who lures victims through personal column advertisements.

filmography.title: Can-Can
filmography.role_description: An older, open-minded judge in 1890s Paris who tries to protect a nightclub owner performing the banned Can-Can dance.
filmography.plot: In 1890s Paris, a judge tries to shut down a nightclub where the illegal Can-Can is performed, but he falls for the owner.

filmography.title: Count Your Blessings
filmography.role_description: A wise and witty French aristocrat who offers advice on marriage and infidelity to an Englishwoman married to his nephew.
filmography.plot: An Englishwoman marries a French aristocrat during the war, but their reunion years later is complicated by his womanizing and their son's meddling.

filmography.title: The Playboy of Paris
filmography.role_description: A waiter who inherits a fortune but is contractually obligated to keep his job, leading him to live a double life.
filmography.plot: A waiter inherits a million francs but his boss refuses to release him from his contract, so he works by day and plays by night.

filmography.title: Break the News
filmography.role_description: A struggling song-and-dance man who conspires with his partner to stage a fake murder to gain publicity.
filmography.plot: Two struggling entertainers stage a fake murder to get their names in the papers, but the 'victim' disappears for real.

filmography.title: The Beloved Vagabond
filmography.role_description: An aspiring architect who becomes a vagabond after a romantic disappointment, traveling the French countryside.
filmography.plot: A French architect poses as a tramp after losing his love to a wealthy count, but finds happiness in a simple life.

filmography.title: A Breath of Scandal
filmography.role_description: The father of an Austrian princess who tries to manage her romantic entanglements and scandal in the court.
filmography.plot: An Austrian princess is exiled from court for a scandal and falls in love with an American mining engineer.

filmography.title: The Way to Love
filmography.role_description: A happy-go-lucky Parisian street guide who dreams of being a real tour guide and falls for a knife-thrower's assistant.
filmography.plot: A Parisian guide obsessed with becoming a professional tour guide gets involved with a carnival performer.

filmography.title: Avec le sourire (With a Smile)
filmography.role_description: A charming, penniless vagrant who uses his wits and smile to climb the social ladder in Paris.
filmography.plot: A penniless man arrives in Paris and uses his charm and cunning to rise to the top of society.

filmography.title: I'd Rather Be Rich
filmography.role_description: A dying tycoon who wants to meet his granddaughter's fiancé before he passes, sparking a deception.
filmography.plot: A wealthy grandfather's dying wish is to see his granddaughter married, leading her to ask a stranger to pose as her fiancé.

filmography.title: Jessica
filmography.role_description: A parish priest in a Sicilian village who tries to mediate the chaos caused by the arrival of a beautiful American midwife.
filmography.plot: The women of a Sicilian village go on a sex strike to force their husbands to stop ogling the beautiful new midwife.

filmography.title: Monkeys, Go Home!
filmography.role_description: A local priest who helps an American heir navigate the hostility of villagers when he uses monkeys to harvest olives.
filmography.plot: An American inherits an olive farm in France and tries to use trained chimpanzees to harvest the crop, angering the locals.

filmography.title: Ma pomme
filmography.role_description: A carefree tramp who inherits a large fortune but is reluctant to give up his vagabond lifestyle.
filmography.plot: A philosophical tramp inherits a vast fortune but finds that money brings more problems than happiness.

filmography.title: Paramount on Parade
filmography.role_description: Chevalier appears in multiple segments, including singing 'Sweeping the Clouds Away' and performing an Apache dance parody.
filmography.plot: A musical revue featuring stars of Paramount Pictures in various comedy and musical sketches.
